feed.subtitle: A simple, whitespace theme for academics. Based on [*folio](https://github.com/bogoli/-folio) design.

entry.title: My First Publication
entry.content: My first paper as a co-author has been published on Advanced Functional Materials. This work has led by my research mentor Yoojin at Georgia Tech.
entry.summary: My first paper as a co-author has been published on Advanced Functional Materials. This work has led by my research mentor Yoojin at Georgia Tech.

entry.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant at Prof. Nam-Soon Choi’s lab at KAIST

link.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant at Prof. Nam-Soon Choi’s lab at KAIST

entry.content: Returning to my home university, I started a new position as an undergraduate research assistant at Energy Materials Lab (PI: Prof. Nam-Soon Choi) at KAIST. I will focus on studying electrolyte additives suitable for Na-ion batteries under low-temperature condition. I’m excited to delve into new kind of system and looking forward to the contribution.
entry.summary: Returning to my home university, I started a new position as an undergraduate research assistant at Energy Materials Lab (PI: Prof. Nam-Soon Choi) at KAIST. I will focus on studying electrolyte additives suitable for Na-ion batteries under low-temperature condition. I’m excited to delve into new kind of system and looking forward to the contribution.

entry.title: Wrapping up my Georgia Tech Exchange Journey

link.title: Wrapping up my Georgia Tech Exchange Journey

entry.content: I’m happy to announce that I’ve successfully finished my exchange program at Georgia Institute of Technology. Adpating to new environment Research experience International community experience
entry.summary: I’m happy to announce that I’ve successfully finished my exchange program at Georgia Institute of Technology. Adpating to new environment Research experience International community experience

entry.title: Georgia Tech 19th UROP Spring Symposium
entry.content: I successfully presented my ongoing research at the 19th UROP Spring Symposium, held at the Exhibition Hall at Georgia Tech. Building on the lessons learned from my previous MRS poster session, I was able to deliver a more refined and effective presentation.
entry.summary: I successfully presented my ongoing research at the 19th UROP Spring Symposium, held at the Exhibition Hall at Georgia Tech. Building on the lessons learned from my previous MRS poster session, I was able to deliver a more refined and effective presentation.

entry.title: Georgia Tech 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition

link.title: Georgia Tech 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition

entry.content: I gave a poster presentation at the 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition, organized by the MRS Chapter at Georgia Tech and held at the Marcus Nanotechnology Building. As an undergraduate researcher, I presented my ongoing work on investigating the effect of surface treatment on Ni/Mn-based Co-free layered oxide cathode for Li-ion Batteries. You can find the poster in the “Project” section of this website. This was my very first poster presentation. The whole processes of desiging the poster, preparing a short pitch, and answering questions from the audience helped me further develop my scientific comuunication skills. It was truly a fantastic experience. I’d like to give a special shout-out to my mentor Yoojin and my advisor Prof. Meilin Liu for their invaluable advice and support.
entry.summary: I gave a poster presentation at the 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition, organized by the MRS Chapter at Georgia Tech and held at the Marcus Nanotechnology Building. As an undergraduate researcher, I presented my ongoing work on investigating the effect of surface treatment on Ni/Mn-based Co-free layered oxide cathode for Li-ion Batteries. You can find the poster in the “Project” section of this website. This was my very first poster presentation. The whole processes of desiging the poster, preparing a short pitch, and answering questions from the audience helped me further develop my scientific comuunication skills. It was truly a fantastic experience. I’d like to give a special shout-out to my mentor Yoojin and my advisor Prof. Meilin Liu for their invaluable advice and support.

entry.title: Excellent Social Service Personnel Award
entry.content: I’m honored to be a receipient of “10th Excellent Social Service Personnel Award” (제10회 사회복무대상) from Korea Military Manpower Administration. I’m currently taking a leave of absence and serving as a social service personnel (an alternative from of the mandatory military service) in Muan Social Welfare Center since November 2022. I was recommended by my supervisor for my diligent attitude during the service period, as well as for my contributions to improving the center’s facilities and my strong client service skills. This news was also featured in a local newspaper.

entry.title: KPF Academic Conference Best Study Award

link.title: KPF Academic Conference Best Study Award

entry.content: I won third prize out of 26 teams in the Best Study Award at the KPF Academic Conference! I submitted the work from my URP (KAIST Undergraduate Research Program) project last year, “Developing an Electrolytic Zn-Mn Battery System and Identifying Key Operating Conditions.” I’m grateful to my mentor Kyungjae and my advisor Prof. Hee-Tak Kim for their support.
entry.summary: I won third prize out of 26 teams in the Best Study Award at the KPF Academic Conference! I submitted the work from my URP (KAIST Undergraduate Research Program) project last year, “Developing an Electrolytic Zn-Mn Battery System and Identifying Key Operating Conditions.” I’m grateful to my mentor Kyungjae and my advisor Prof. Hee-Tak Kim for their support.
